nodes.bodyText: is /larc a standard context root? I presume that it can be customized by overriding this line in the server.xml?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,13 @@
+<!--
+    Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+    All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+    are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+    which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+    http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+   
+    Contributors:
+        IBM Corporation - initial implementation
+ -->
+<server>
+    <application context-root="/lrac" type="war" id="lra-c" location="${wlp.install.dir}/lib/mpLRACoordinator_5.10.5.jar"/>

nodes.bodyText: It was a random choice by me. I have an issue open to add config for this. I'll add a comment in the issue to say that a sensible default also needs to be chosen

nodes.bodyText: I suspect that is the kind of detail that should have been in the UFO? If it wasn't please update the UFO.

nodes.bodyText: Interesting list of packages to exclude? How did you arrive at this list?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,61 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#    IBM Corporation 
+# This wraps the external JAR.
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/rejar.props
+
+narayanaVersion=5.10.5
+bVersion=1.0
+# bFullVersion must be a semantic version string (the build verifies it)
+# It should match the narayana version used below as far as posible. If the
+# version here is updated, then the matching values in 
+#  * the mpLRACoordinator feature file
+#  * defaultInstances.xml in the io.openliberty.microprofile.lra.coordinator.internal project
+# need to be updated as well
+bFullVersion=${narayanaVersion}
+
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.org.jboss.narayana.rts.lra-coordinator; singleton:=true
+                     
+# This bnd file is used to build a wab, which is then loaded as a war file via
+# defaultInstances.xml in the mpLraCoordinator feature
+-wab
+-outputmask: mpLRACoordinator.jar
+
+  
+Private-Package: \
+    com.arjuna*, \
+    org.jboss.logging*, \
+    io.narayana.lra*
+    
+
+# The excluded packages appear to be optional parts of narayana
+# They are excluded here, as otherwise the jars would need to be
+# dragged into the bundle which would make it huge. If a decision
+# is made to support more of the optional parts of narayana in future, 
+# some of the excluded packages may need to be added back 
+Import-Package: \
+    !android.os, \
+    !com.arjuna.ats.internal.jta, \
+    !com.sun.tools.jconsole, \
+    !org.apache.activemq.artemis.core*, \
+    !org.jfree*, \
+    !org.eclipse.microprofile.openapi*, \

nodes.bodyText:
Running the build and looking for bnd import failures, and investigation of what they are used for.
They are I believe all for optional parts of narayana which are not needed by the LRA implementation
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: There seem to be a number of duplicates here?
At some point we should make the script that enforces the alphabetical order also check for duplicate lines
